title: ISic003009. Dedication to Damater(?)
body:
1Δάμ̣[ατρι καὶ Κόραι]
2βασιλ [έα Ἱερώνυμον]
3βασι [λέος Γέλωνος]
4[Συρακόσιοι]

1ΔΑ.[............]
2ΒΑΣΙΛ[...........]
3ΒΑΣΙ[...........]
4[..........]

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of Manganaro 1977, checked against stone

English translation

The Syracusans dedicate (this statue of) King Hieronymos, son of King Gelon, to Damater and Kore

commentary

The text is speculatively restored in several different ways by previous editors: the text of Manganaro 1977 is provided here as an example; Gentili 1961 instead suggested a dedication to Demeter and Kore by Gelon, son of Hieron. Manganaro is correct that there is theoretically space for a shorter fourth line, and the dedication to Zeus Hellanios in honour of Gelon (ISic003331 provides a plausible parallel.

bibliography

  • 56.1103.2.2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796

  • Manganaro 1963 24 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001848
  • Manganaro 1965 186 no.2 tav.64 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001841
  • Manganaro 1965 315 n.11 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001840
  • Manganaro 1977 155-156 dr ph
  • Dimartino 2006 no.2.2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002022
